1.Name: continues
1.Label: continues
1.Notes: Indicates (A) is a continuation of the work (B).

3.Name: hasAccessRestriction
3.Label: has access restriction
3.Notes: Denotes if restricted access applies to the Resource (A). Choose from list.

4.Name: hasActor
4.Label: has actor
4.Notes: Any Person or Organisation (B) which the given Project, Collection or Resource (A) mentions or is about.

5.Name: hasAuthor
5.Label: has author
5.Notes: Author of the resource who will appear in its citation. Especially meant for written resources. All other kinds of creators should be included with hasCreator.

6.Name: hasCategory
6.Label: has category
6.Notes: Type of Resource, e.g. image. Choose from list. Can be refined with hasDescription, hasFormat, hasExtent, etc.

7.Name: hasContact
7.Label: has contact
7.Notes:
Person or Organisation (B) that can be contacted regarding information about a Resource, a Collection or a Project (A).
Person with knowledge of how to access, troubleshoot or otherwise field issues related to the resource. (cf. DataCite: ContactPerson)

8.Name: hasContributor
8.Label: has contributor
8.Notes:
Person or Organisation (B) who was actively involved in creating, curating or editing a Resource, a Collection or a Project (A). Any person or institution making a significant contribution to the development and/or maintenance of the resource, but whose contribution does not “fit” to another already defined role. (cf. DataCite: Other)
This is a generic property. Use one of the more specific subproperties where possible.

9.Name: hasCoverage
9.Label: has coverage
9.Notes: Generic indication of what is covered/mentioned (B) in the resource (its content) (A) along various dimensions (subject, space, time). Use the more specific sub-properties where possible. E.g. the time span '1874-1883' for a set of images depicting the construction of the parliament in Vienna, the actor 'Mozart' for an edition about Mozart or the place 'Vienna' for a collection of city maps of Vienna.

10.Name: hasCreator
10.Label: has creator
10.Notes: Person (B) responsible for the (content) creation of resource (A). Will be included in the citation.

11.Name: hasCurator
11.Label: has curator
11.Notes: Person (B) tasked with reviewing, enhancing, cleaning or standardising data and the associated metadata submitted for storage, use and maintenance within a data centre or repository. (cf. DataCite: DataCurator)

12.Name: hasDepositor
12.Label: has depositor
12.Notes: Person or organisation (B) responsible for submitting a resource (A) to the repository.

13.Name: hasDigitisingAgent
13.Label: has digitising agent
13.Notes: Person or Organisation (B) responsible for creating the digital representation of a Collection or a Resource (A) of an analogue object. This for example includes persons responsible for scanning 2D analogue resources, 3D scanning of objects and entering data into a structured digital representation (e.g. spreadsheet, database, XML) from an existing analogue resource.

14.Name: hasEditor
14.Label: has editor
14.Notes: A person who oversees the details related to the publication format of the resource. (cf. DataCite: Editor)

15.Name: hasFunder
15.Label: has funder
15.Notes: Person or Organisation (B) which provided funding for a project (A). Person or organisation that issued a contract or under the auspices of which a work has been written, printed, published, developed, etc. (cf. DataCite: Sponsor)

16.Name: hasHosting
16.Label: has hosting
16.Notes: Institution responsible for preservation and hosting of a resource. (cf. DataCite: HostingInstitution) Typically, the organisation allowing the resource to be available on the internet through the provision of its hardware, software and operating support.

17.Name: hasIdentifier
17.Label: has identifier
17.Notes:
Unique identifier given by ARCHE and used in ARCHE systems, as well as identifiers with a stable URL or URI assigned by other parties, e.g. a DOI, a geonames ID or an URN.
Input as URI.
Handles belong into hasPid and all other identifiers without URL or URI, like local assigned ones, project numbers or inventory numbers into hasNonLinkedIdentifier.

18.Name: hasLanguage
18.Label: has language
18.Notes: Language used in the entity. Encoded with 3-letter code according to ISO-639-3 (e.g. deu, eng, arz).

19.Name: hasLicense
19.Label: has license
19.Notes: Denotes the license attached to an object.

20.Name: hasLicensor
20.Label: has licensor
20.Notes: Person or Organisation (B) responsible for choosing a license for the object (A).

21.Name: hasLifeCycleStatus
21.Label: has life cycle status
21.Notes: Indication if the Project or Collection (A) is still in the making or completed. A verbose status description can be added with acdh:hasCompleteness.

22.Name: hasMetadataCreator
22.Label: has metadata creator
22.Notes: Person or Organisation (B) responsible for creating metadata describing an entity according to the ARCHE schema. Additional structured and machine readable metadata in a format like a TEI, CMDI, LIDO etc. can be added as an entity of the Class Metadata.

23.Name: hasNextItem
23.Label: has next item
23.Notes: Indicates the next item (B) following the current object (A). With this property, the order of Resources or Collections within a containing Collection can be established. If no value is given, the property is automatically filled based on ascending alphabetical sorting of the file names.

24.Name: hasOaiSet
24.Label: has oai set
24.Notes: OAI-PMH set a Project, Collection, Resource or Metadata belongs to. Choose from list. By default, the value 'https://vocabs.acdh.oeaw.ac.at/archeoaisets/openaire_data' is set for the parent collection (TopCollection) to be visible in OpenAIRE.

25.Name: hasOwner
25.Label: has owner
25.Notes: Person or Organisation (B) who owns a given Collection or Resource (A).

26.Name: hasPrincipalInvestigator
26.Label: has principal investigator
26.Notes: Person officially designated as head of project team or subproject team instrumental in the work necessary to development of the resource. (cf. DataCite: ProjectLeader)

27.Name: hasRelatedCollection
27.Label: has related collection
27.Notes: Indication of a Collection (B) associated to a Project (A).

28.Name: hasRelatedDiscipline
28.Label: has related discipline
28.Notes: Research discipline of Project, Collection or Resource. Choose from list. Can be used for search.

29.Name: hasRelatedProject
29.Label: has related project
29.Notes: Indication of a Project (B) associated with this Collection (A).

30.Name: hasRightsHolder
30.Label: has rights holder
30.Notes: Person or Organisation (B) owning or managing property rights, including intellectual property rights over the resource (A). (cf. DataCite: RightsHolder)

31.Name: hasSpatialCoverage
31.Label: has spatial coverage
31.Notes: Geographical location, area, region (B) a Project, Collection or Resource (A) is dealing with, is about; e.g. archaeological data from excavations in 'Pannonia' or a collection of digitised newspapers from 'Austria'.

32.Name: isDerivedPublicationOf
32.Label: is derived publication
32.Notes: A Publication (A) derived from a Project, Collection or a Resource (B).

33.Name: isMemberOf
33.Label: is member of
33.Notes: Used to link a Person to an Organisation or an Organisation (e.g. department) to another Organisation (institution).

34.Name: isMetadataFor
34.Label: is metadata for
34.Notes: Indicates the metadata resource (A) contains additional metadata for another Resource, Collection or Project (B).

35.Name: isNewVersionOf
35.Label: is new version of
35.Notes: Indicates a resource (A) is a new version of another resource (B), where the new version has been modified or updated. Important: Only one parent per resource is allowed, i.e. resource (B) cannot have resource (A) and another resource (C) as newer versions. But resource (A) can be a newer version of resource (B) and resource (C).

36.Name: isObjectMetadataFor
36.Label: is object metadata for
36.Notes: Indicates the metadata resource (A) contains metadata describing a physical object which is digitally represented in a Resource or Collection (B).

37.Name: isPartOf
37.Label: is part of
37.Notes: Indicates an object (A) is a part of an aggregate collection (B), e.g. items of a Collection or a Place within another Place.

38.Name: isSourceOf
38.Label: is source of
38.Notes: Indicates an entity (B) is based on a source (A).

39.Name: isTitleImageOf
39.Label: is title image of
39.Notes: Title image or logo of Organisation, Project, Collection or Resource used for presentation.

40.Name: relation
40.Label: relation
40.Notes: A generic indication of any relation between two resources. Preferably use any of the more specific subproperties.

41.Name: aclRead
41.Label: acl read
41.Notes: ARCHE API user having read rights on the resource. Technical property, thus no curation required.

42.Name: aclUpdate
42.Label: acl update
42.Notes: ARCHE API user having update rights on the resource. Technical property, thus no curation required.

43.Name: aclWrite
43.Label: acl write
43.Notes: ARCHE API user having write rights on the resource. Technical property, thus no curation required.

44.Name: createdBy
44.Label: created by
44.Notes: The ARCHE API user who created the resource. Technical property, thus no curation required.

45.Name: disseminationServices
45.Label: dissemination services
45.Notes: A common parent property for properties related to dissemination services.

46.Name: hasAcceptedDate
46.Label: has accepted date
46.Notes: The date the resource was accepted by the repository.

47.Name: hasAccessRestrictionSummary
47.Label: has access restriction summary
47.Notes:
Denotes which access restrictions apply to the resources in the collection. Is filled by the system. The property gathers the titles of the vocabulary used for child resources (has access restriction) along with the amount of resources per each value. It is computed for all child resources of type acdh:BinaryContent (Image, Resource, Metadata).

Vocabulary for access restrictions https://vocabs.acdh.oeaw.ac.at/archeaccessrestrictions/Schema:
public
academic
restricted
Example: public 87, academic 3, restricted 1

48.Name: hasAddress
48.Label: has address
48.Notes: Address associated with a Person, Organisation or Publication. Places can also be described with address properties. Use sub-properties to input detailed information like postcode, city and country.

49.Name: hasAddressLine1
49.Label: has address line 1
49.Notes: First line of address associated with a Person or Organisation.

50.Name: hasAddressLine2
50.Label: has address line 2
50.Notes: Second line of address associated with a Person or Organisation.

51.Name: hasAlternativeTitle
51.Label: has alternative title
51.Notes: Alternative title or name of Project, Collection or Resource. Can also be used as alternative name for an organisation.

52.Name: hasAppliedMethod
52.Label: has applied method
52.Notes: The methodology (B) applied in creation of a resource or in a project (A). (cf. DataCite: descriptionType methods) Can further be described with data property hasappliedMethodDescription.

53.Name: hasAppliedMethodDescription
53.Label: has applied method description
53.Notes: Verbose description of the methodology employed in the creation of a resource or in a project. (cf. DataCite: descriptionType methods)

54.Name: hasArrangement
54.Label: has arrangement
54.Notes: Indicates a logical and coherent overall view of the whole set of objects in the Collection. Here the description of folder structure, nature of relationship between objects and metadata, etc. are expected. If necessary, diagrams or screenshots from the original system can be included.

55.Name: hasAvailableDate
55.Label: has available date
55.Notes: The date the repository resource was created in ARCHE.

56.Name: hasBinarySize
56.Label: has binary size
56.Notes: Indicates size in bytes of a Resource or Collection.

57.Name: hasBinaryUpdatedDate
57.Notes: The date of the last resource's binary payload update; in contrary to acdh:hasUpdatedDate which indicates any resource modification including metadata-only ones.

58.Name: hasBinaryUpdatedRole
58.Label: has binary updated role
58.Notes: ARCHE API user who modified the resource's binary payload for the last time.

59.Name: hasCharacterEncoding
59.Label: has character encoding
59.Notes:
Information about character encoding used and also information about non-standard characters and glyphs used.
Indicate character encoding according to the overview of Character Sets by IANA: https://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets/character-sets.xhtml

60.Name: hasCity
60.Label: has city
60.Notes: City or Town of address associated with a Person or Organisation.

61.Name: hasCollectedEndDate
61.Label: has collected end date
61.Notes: The date or date range in which the resource content was collected, e. g. duration of a measuring campaign. End date.

62.Name: hasCollectedStartDate
62.Label: has collected start date
62.Notes: The date or date range in which the resource content was collected, e. g. duration of a measuring campaign. If a date range should be indicated add the end date with hasCollectedEndDate.

63.Name: hasCompleteness
63.Label: has completeness
63.Notes: Descriptive statement about how complete the Collection is.

64.Name: hasCountry
64.Label: has country
64.Notes: Country of address associated with a Person or Organisation.

65.Name: hasCoverageEndDate
65.Label: has coverage end date
65.Notes: End date for temporal coverage (B), i.e. end of the period a Project, Collection or Resource (A) deals with.

66.Name: hasCoverageStartDate
66.Label: has coverage start date
66.Notes: Date or date range for temporal coverage (B) a Project, Collection or Resource (A) deals with, e.g. a period. If a date range should be indicated add the end date with hasCoverageEndDate.

67.Name: hasCreatedEndDate
67.Label: has created end date
67.Notes: The end date the Resource or Collection itself was put together.

68.Name: hasCreatedEndDateOriginal
68.Label: has created end date original
68.Notes: The end date the original entity of the digital object was created, e.g. date of a drawing that was digitised.

69.Name: hasCreatedStartDate
69.Label: has created start date
69.Notes: The date the Resource or Collection itself was put together. If a date range should be indicated add the end date with hasCreatedEndDate.

70.Name: hasCreatedStartDateOriginal
70.Label: has created start date original
70.Notes: The date the original entity of the digital object was created, e.g. date of a drawing that was digitised. If a date range should be indicated add the end date with hasCreatedEndDateOriginal.

71.Name: hasCustomCitation
71.Label: has custom citation
71.Notes: Allows submission of a custom citation. Either for the full citation or only parts of it, like e.g. authors in a specific order. Input in BibTeX (.bib) format (cf. https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/LaTeX/Bibliography_Management#BibTeX).

72.Name: hasCustomXsl
72.Label: has custom xsl
72.Notes: Points to an XSL stylesheet (B) which is used to transform the related resource (A) with a dedicated dissemination service.

73.Name: hasDate
73.Label: has date
73.Notes: A date related to an entity (Project, Collection or Resource). Preferably use any of the more specific subproperties.

74.Name: hasDefaultValue
74.Label: has default value
74.Notes: Provides default value of the dissemination service parameter.

75.Name: hasDescription
75.Label: has description
75.Notes: A verbose description of certain aspects (content, coverage, completeness, extent, motivation, etc.) of an entity. This is the most generic property, use more specific sub-properties where applicable.

76.Name: hasEditorialPractice
76.Label: has editorial practice
76.Notes: Details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of a text. Only relevant for digital editions.

77.Name: hasEmail
77.Label: has email
77.Notes: E-mail address associated with a Person or Organisation.

78.Name: hasEndDate
78.Label: has end date
78.Notes: Indicates the end date of a Project.

79.Name: hasExtent
79.Label: has extent
79.Notes: Indicates the extent (size or dimension) of a resource in any suitable measuring units. Units should also be indicated. E.g. "Total: 4 folders, 6 subfolders, 3031 files".

80.Name: hasFilename
80.Label: has filename
80.Notes: File name of the repository resource's binary content

82.Name: hasFormat
82.Label: has format
82.Notes: Format of a Resource (A). Indicated as MIME type.

83.Name: hasHash
83.Label: has hash
83.Notes: Hash of the repository resource's binary content

84.Name: hasIiifManifest
84.Label: has custom iiif manifest
84.Notes: Indicates the IIIF manifest (B) to be used for the presentation of the Resource (A). The value is either an URL of the IIIF manifest to be used (we recommend it to be another Resource in the repository but it can also be external) or, if the IIIF manifest should be generated automatically based on the Resource's metadata, the URI of the dissemination service: https://id.acdh.oeaw.ac.at/dissemination/iiifmanifest.

85.Name: hasIssuedDate
85.Label: has issued date
85.Notes: Indicates the date when a Publication was issued.

87.Name: hasLatitude
87.Label: has latitude
87.Notes: Geographic coordinate that specifies the north-south position of a point on the Earth's surface. Use signed degrees format (DD.dddd), e.g. -31.9600. Latitudes range from -90 to 90.

88.Name: hasLicenseSummary
88.Label: has license summary
88.Notes:
Denotes all licenses contained in the Collection with the number of occurrences. Is filled  by the system.
Vocabulary for licenses: https://vocabs.acdh.oeaw.ac.at/archelicenses/Schema
Example: CC-BY 4.0 - 884, CC0 1.0 - 44

89.Name: hasLiteralIdentifier
89.Label: has literal identifier
89.Notes: A common parent for datatype properties storing identifiers. A purely technical property which should not be used directly. Use one of more specific subproperties instead (hasNonLinkedIdentifier, hasPid, hasTemporalCoverageIdentifier).

90.Name: hasLongitude
90.Label: has longitude
90.Notes: Geographic coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point on the Earth's surface. Use signed degrees format (DDD.dddd), e.g. 115.8400. Longitudes range from -180 to 180.

91.Name: hasMetadataPid
91.Label: has metadata pid
91.Notes: Persistent identifier that will be attached to a CMDI record that is automatically created from the metadata describing the Collection, Resource or Metadata. In ARCHE it is usually a Handle. It will be automatically created if the resource is part of the OAI-PMH set 'clarin-vlo'.

92.Name: hasNamingScheme
92.Label: has naming scheme
92.Notes: Conventions used for naming and structuring of files and folders in a Collection.

93.Name: hasNonLinkedIdentifier
93.Label: has non linked identifier
93.Notes:
Unique identifier assigned by other parties without stable URL or URI, e.g. a number assigned by the funder, an ID from another publication place or an inventory number.
Should be a literal in the form of prefix:identifier, e.g. "Österreichische Nationalbank Jubiläumsfond:16365".
Handles belong into hasPid and identifiers with stable URL or URI into hasIdentifier.

94.Name: hasNote
94.Label: has note
94.Notes: Any other notes for the described object not fitting into an existing category. (cf. DataCite: descriptionType Other)

95.Name: hasNumberOfItems
95.Label: has number of items
95.Notes: Indicates the number of items (Resources) included in a Collection.

96.Name: hasPages
96.Label: has pages
96.Notes: Denotes a page or a range of pages for a Publication. Please insert just the pages without 'pp' or 'S', e.g. '2-51' or '3'.

97.Name: hasPersonalTitle
97.Label: has personal title
97.Notes: Professional or academic title of a Person.

98.Name: hasPid
98.Label: has pid
98.Notes:
Persistent identifier globally assigned to a Project, Collection or Resource. In ARCHE usually a Handle. A new Handle will be created if the identifier provided equals 'create'.
All other identifiers, like local assigned ones, project numbers or inventory numbers belong into hasIdentifier or hasNonLinkedIdentifier if no URL or URI is available.

99.Name: hasPostcode
99.Label: has postcode
99.Notes: Postcode or zip code of address associated with a Person or Organisation.

100.Name: hasPublisher
100.Label: has publisher
100.Notes: Publisher (aka publishing house) of a Publication. A literal only used for Publications.

101.Name: hasRawBinarySize
101.Label: has raw binary size
101.Notes: Binary size of resource's binary payload. Exists only for resources with a binary payload.

102.Name: hasRegion
102.Label: has region
102.Notes: State, region or province of address associated with a Person or Organisation.

103.Name: hasRestrictionRole
103.Label: has restriction role
103.Notes: Name of role or user allowed to access the Resource or Collection.

104.Name: hasReturnType
104.Label: has return type
104.Notes: Identifier of the output type generated by a dissemination service. It can be a MIME type or any other string (which is needed sometimes as MIME types may be not precise enough, e.g. many dissemination services can produce text/html output).

105.Name: hasRightsInformation
105.Label: has rights information
105.Notes: Additional information about the rights status and licensing of the Resource(s) relevant for its publishing and reuse. For example: the type of rights the license applies to (copyright, related rights, terms and conditions of Resource owner) or type of exception or limitation of the Austrian Urheberrechtsgesetz (Copyright Law) allowing the publication of the Resource.

106.Name: hasSchema
106.Label: has schema
106.Notes: Reference to a definition of the structure of the Resource (A). This could be a XML schema, a SQL-DB definition, an ontology, etc.

107.Name: hasSeriesInformation
107.Label: has series information
107.Notes: Information about a repeating series of a Publication, such as volume, issue, number. (cf. DataCite: descriptionType seriesInformation)

108.Name: hasStartDate
108.Label: has start date
108.Notes: Indicates the start date of a Project.

109.Name: hasSubject
109.Label: has subject
109.Notes: Subject of Project, Collection or Resource. Can be used as keywords for search.

110.Name: hasSubmissionDate
110.Label: has submission date
110.Notes: The date the depositor submitted the Resource or Collection to the repository. This can differ from hasAcceptedDate if the repository applied a selection process.

111.Name: hasTableOfContents
111.Label: has table of contents
111.Notes: A listing of the Table of Contents. (cf. DataCite: descriptionType tableOfContents)

113.Name: hasTechnicalInfo
113.Label: has technical info
113.Notes: Detailed information that may be associated with the design, implementation, operation, use, and/ or maintenance of a process or system. (cf. DataCite: descriptionType technicalInfo)

114.Name: hasTemporalCoverage
114.Label: has temporal coverage
114.Notes: Temporal coverage of the content of a Resource or Collection with period terms, e.g. 'Roman' for some archaeological data or 'First Viennese School' for a collection of musical notes from 1770-1830. Precise years and dates can be indicated with hasCoverageStartDate and hasCoverageEndDate.

115.Name: hasTemporalCoverageIdentifier
115.Notes:
Used to attach an identifier for temporal terms. E.g. from http://perio.do/ or http://chronontology.dainst.org/.
Input as URI.

116.Name: hasTitle
116.Label: has title
116.Notes:
Title or name of an entity.
If left empty for a Person it is automatically computed by combining first and last names.

117.Name: hasTransferDate
117.Label: has transfer date
117.Notes: Date of transfer of the Resource or Collection to the repository. Is asked for in the Deposition Agreement.

118.Name: hasTransferMethod
118.Label: has transfer method
118.Notes: Method used to transfer data from depositor to repository.

119.Name: hasUpdatedDate
119.Label: has updated date
119.Notes: The date of the last update or change to the resource.

120.Name: hasUpdatedRole
120.Label: has updated role
120.Notes: ARCHE API user who modified the resource for the last time.

121.Name: hasUrl
121.Label: has url
121.Notes: Used to add URLs for a resource. E.g. a project web page or a personal page of a person.

122.Name: hasUsedHardware
122.Label: has used hardware
122.Notes: Hardware used for creating or processing the Resource or Collection. Provide name including model numbers, versions etc.

123.Name: hasUsedSoftware
123.Label: has used software
123.Notes: Software used for creating or processing of the Resource or Collection. Provide name of software and version used.

124.Name: hasVersion
124.Label: has version
124.Notes: Number or name of the version of the Collection or the Resource.

125.Name: hasVersionInfo
125.Label: has version info
125.Notes: Provides a description of the nature and significance of the changes made if the resource represents a new version of an entity already ingested in ARCHE.

126.Name: hasWKT
126.Label: has wkt
126.Notes: Well-known text (WKT) of a Place for representation on a map. WKT is defined by ISO 19162. Wicket might be used to create valid WKT: http://arthur-e.github.io/Wicket/sandbox-gmaps3.html.

127.Name: isRequired
127.Label: is required
127.Notes: Indicates if a given matching rule has to be fulfilled to match a resource.

128.Name: matchesProp
128.Label: matches prop
128.Notes: Indicates the RDF property of which its value is compared with the acdh:matchesProp to check if a given dissemination service match rule is fulfilled.

129.Name: matchesValue
129.Label: matches value
129.Notes: Indicates the value matched by the dissemination service matching rule.

131.Name: serviceRevProxy
131.Notes: Indicates if a dissemination service uses a reverse proxy.

132.Name: technical
132.Label: technical
132.Notes: A parent for properties used by the ARCHE system components arche-core and arche-lib-disserv, which are purely technical and do not require curation.

133.Name: usesRdfProperty
133.Label: uses rdf property
133.Notes: Indicates a resource's RDF property holding the dissemination service parameter value.
